name: South African Melktert (Milk Tart)
author: TWAKMUIS
summary: My 'ouma' South African grandmother's legendary milk tart. It is lip-smacking. The recipe is a real winner. It is a traditional South African tart that is very easy to prepare.
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Coat a 9 inch deep dish pie plate with vegetable oil cooking spray
In a large bowl, mix together the butter and sugar until smooth
Add the egg yolks and beat until light and fluffy
Sift in the cake flour, baking powder and salt, and stir until well blended
Mix in the vanilla and milk
In a separate bowl, whip the egg whites to stiff peaks using an electric mixer
Pour into the prepared pie plate, and sprinkle cinnamon sugar over the top
Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce the temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Continue to bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the center is set when you gently jiggle the pie
